```{r, include=FALSE}
  library(ggplot2)
  library(dplyr)
  library(readxl)
  library(viridisLite)
  library(plotly)
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
  data <- read_excel("Base_de_datos/DataBase_Markers_CENHV.xlsx")
  rhg_cols <- c( "#370617", "#6A040F", "#771C19", "#AA3929", "#E25033", "#F27314", "#F8A31B",
               "#E2C59F", "#B6C5CC", "#8E9CA3", "#556670", "#000000", "#03071E")
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
  #Tabla de frecuencias por tipo
  type <- ftable(data$SSR_type)
  typeData <- as.data.frame(type)
  names(typeData)[2] = "Frecuencia"
  typeData = arrange(typeData, desc(Frecuencia))
  #secuencias frecuentes
  seque <- ftable(data$SSR_summary_sequence)
  sequeData <- as.data.frame(seque)
  sequeData = arrange(sequeData, desc(Freq))
  sequeMain <- top_n( sequeData, 10, Freq)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.height = 4, fig.align ='center'}
  # Pie plot
  typeData$fraction = typeData$Frecuencia / sum(typeData$Frecuencia)
  
  typeData$ymax = cumsum(typeData$fraction)
  
  typeData$ymin = c(0, head(typeData$ymax, n=-1))
  
  ggplot(typeData, aes(ymax=ymax, ymin=ymin, xmax=4, xmin=3, fill=Var1)) +
     geom_rect() +
     scale_fill_manual(values = rhg_cols)+
     coord_polar(theta="y") + # Try to remove that to understand how the chart is built initially
     xlim(c(2, 4)) + # Try to remove that to see how to make a pie chart
     ggtitle("Motiv Size Distribution") +
     theme_minimal()
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.height = 4, fig.align ='center'}
  #Barplot
sequeMain$Var1 = with(sequeMain, reorder(Var1, -Freq, .fun='length'))

sequeMain%>%
    ggplot(aes(x=Var1, y=Freq, fill=Var1)) + 
    geom_col() +
    scale_fill_manual(values = rhg_cols)+
    xlab("Sequences") + ylab ("Frequency") + ggtitle("Most Frequent Repeats") +
    theme_minimal()
    #theme(legend.position = "none",axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 35, hjust = 1))
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.height = 4, fig.align ='center'}
fig <- plot_ly(
    x = sequeMain$Var1,
    y = sequeMain$Freq,
    type = 'bar',
    text = sequeMain$Var1,
  )
fig <- fig %>% layout(
    title = 'Most Frequent Repeats',
    xaxis = list(
      type = 'category',
      title = 'Sequences'
    ),
    yaxis = list(
      title = 'Frequency',
      range = c(0,16)
    )
  )
fig
```
